lines.text: It's these folks. They're all so wonderful.
Well, all folks is wonderful. You just have to know the right place to kick 'em in.
What?
Sure. It's like learnin' to play a musical instrument by ear. All you gotta know is what place to push to get what note. Then pretty soon, everybody's dancin'...to your tune.
I've been your wife ever since I knowed what the word meant.
Brighten up, sweet-face, brighten up, 'cause you married a winner, not a loser!
Polli, anyone ever warn you - Flamingo ever warn you about makin' a house pet of a wildcat?
I don't believe she ever mentioned it.
Well, you might get bit.

[Angrily]
Castleberry, there's a disease called Pellegra. You ever hear how it's ommunicated?
Hank, we were talkin' about the house...
It's communicated by not gettin' enough to eat, and it's very common in counties where your cotton gins are.
[to Jules]
Jules, I'm very sorry. I don't mean any offense to you, but my wife and I can't eat where a man what's been committin' pellegra.
Well, I don't...
I think I do. Would you mind explainin' your remark, sir?
Not at all. I'm callin' you a thief... a blood-suckin' thief!
Hank, that's enough. You know very well there's a state inspection board that takes care of them things.
What I wanna know is who inspects the inspectors?
Governor Charles Swindon inspects the inspectors. He's a self-made man just like you, and he's my friend... and he's honest, just like Robert Castleberry, who also happens to be my godfather.
Well, Jules, I never had no godfather, and I was almost too poor to have a father, so I must be poor, and you must be vey. very, right.
Wheels within wheels within wheels.
Well, sometimes a man just don't got time for common sense.
